channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2023100091
item.description:
Report E-2023100091

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced a UN3266 Flash Clene 1414 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.55-gallons of product released to the tote body only due to a puncture. The tote was transferred from the damaged container into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100089
item.description:
Report E-2023100089

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN2810 Allyl Hexanoate release from a 30-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 2’ area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum, impacted absorbents, and PPE were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100083
item.description:
Report E-2023100083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: SARALAND
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NML experienced a UN3109 TBHP-70-AQ release from a 5-gallon jerrican due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and advised terminal personnel had already conducted cleanup and placed the damaged jug and impacted absorbents into a closed top poly drum. The crew removed the damaged jug from the drum and placed it into a 55-gallon vented poly drum, confirming 1-gallon released. The impacted drum was then cut up and containerized along with the impacted absorbents into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090845
item.description:
Report E-2023090845

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: OREGON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: K-Limited Carrier LTD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The K-Limited Carrier LTD driver had just completed loading the trailer with sulfuric acid. The driver was attempting to relieve the pressure from the loading line when he was sprayed with a small amount of sulfuric acid. It appears that the loading line was over-pressurized which caused the product to be released. The plant personnel handled the clean-up. The driver was treated and released at a local hospital.

item.title: Report E-2023100090
item.description:
Report E-2023100090

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel collected one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of paint and placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent and absorbent pads to the paint-impacted surfaces and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All paint impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums. RLC personnel took possession of all three (3) drums of waste.

item.title: Report E-2023100088
item.description:
Report E-2023100088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2023, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (10W) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the impacted cargo and secured the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The crew utilized absorbents to collect the released material. All impacted solids were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report E-2023100084
item.description:
Report E-2023100084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2023, eighteen (18) 5-gallon pails of UN1133 were crushed and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the dock floor and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The undamaged cargo was down stacked for inspection and wiped down with absorbent pads to remove any residual product. The remaining freight was repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All spent absorbents and impacted pails were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon and one (1) 95-gallon drums for disposal purposes. The drums were properly labeled and possession of the material was taken by R+L.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: unload manager called Qa for a Hazmat spill. He said the pallet had tipped over in transit and when the package handler was unloading it the one on the bottom started leaking. Qa came with spill pads and a tote. The leaker was put in a tote. When QA came to clean up spill, we realized that the Hazmat was leaking all the way down the trailer and outside. We immediately called ERTS. Hazmat cleaning company came and cleaned up the spill. They immediately put the leaker in a salvage drum. No pictures were taken and not exactly sure how many leaked out. This leaker also damaged 4 other Hazmat's. DescribePack: The pallet had tipped over during transit causing the Hazmat on the bottom to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was put in a tote and spill pads were put down in the trailer.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspecting the inner contents of 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Nu Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner. The 2 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Nu Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner had crushed in caps allowing .10 gallons to release from each bottle. There was a corrugated liner to separate plastic bottles and a liner used on the top of bottles for packing. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 2 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Nu Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner had crushed in caps allowing .10 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking box, then was taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection.

  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN1866 L010-PPA-33 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces of material released to the tote body only due to a puncture on the top corner of the tote caused by an unknown source. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged empty tote was then patched and poly sheeting was placed over the tote for disposal. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in dump chute in warehouse, very wet/leaking & torn open. Line manager removed package from dump chute and placed into a red hazmat bin lined with a plastic hazmat bag. Manager brought package to back QA cage for inspection. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When discovered, package was immediately placed into a lined hazmat bin. Leak in dump chute was cleaned with disposable absorbent cloth towels. Gloves worn while cleaning.

DescribePack: Metal aerosol cans in corrugated carton without dividers. No hazard markings on exterior. One can dented and cracked at base by impact with adjacent can. Contents spilled, soiling other cans and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report E-2023100034
item.description:
Report E-2023100034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1210 was crushed during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. R+L terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to HES' arrival. HES personnel swept in the previously deployed granular absorbents with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted trailer interior, pallet, and nearby freight with absorbent pads and a degreaser. All spent absorbents, the pail of solidified product, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: On September 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was crushed in transit and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN1760 impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 35-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • City: CORDELE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer floor and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC transferred the damaged drum from the trailer to an 85-gallon overpack for transport and disposal. The crew deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and concrete pavement. AOTC utilized hand tools to collect the spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. AOTC staged the drums onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded at the site of the contractors truck. A package handler noticed an odor and saw that the package was leaking and notified a manager. The oil dri was swept up and put into a hazmat bag. DescribePack: There was room for four bottles and the cardboard that was put on top was insufficient to keep the bottles from shifting. One of the bottles broke in the middle and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into a tub and Oil Dri was applied to the spill. The Oil Dri was then swept up and put into a hazmat bag.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSX experienced a UN1760 Sparchlor 309055 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of material released to an 80’ x 20’ area of the trailer, dock, and parking lot due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: When driver went to go hook to trailer in drop lot he noticed liquid coming from trailer on the gravel lot. Driver then notified facility manager and a team was dispatcher out to facilitate the clean up. The trailer was moved to the dock to pull the container off and put on a containment pallet and absorbent was put down to prevent any spread of the material until the team could start the clean up. The response team arrived and had to remove the material from the container and put into a new one. Gravel from the lot had to be removed creating three 55 gallon drums of material. The inner liner of the bag was determined to be damaged from when it was filled causing the release. From the time it was identified to when clean up was complete was approximately 4 hours.

THEY WERE HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE CAP BEING LOOSE AND ALSO CRACKED CAUSING 2 BOTTLES OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID TO BE DAMAGED. ( LEAKING). DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

HEPACO was immediately contacted, located the affected drain, and noted no fuel in the downstream inlet. HEPACO flushed the drain system with clean water and captured the resulting fuel/water mixture with a vacuum truck. Booms were placed in the inlet to capture any residual fuel. Cleanup was managed by CDG on behalf of Eagle.

  • Description: Driver stopped to get fuel at the truck stop while performing a walk around when fueling he noticed a liquid coming from bottom of trailer. The driver then opened the trailer to inspect the load and found liquid on the floor of the trailer. The driver then relocated the truck to a safe location in the parking lot and call our Emergency Response Line and a team was dispatched out to clean up the release. When the team arrived they put on the appropriate PPE and proceeded with the clean up. They put down absorbent mats to collect the material and put into a salvage drum along with the damaged drum to be disposed of in accordance with regulations. The 55 gallon steel drum was determined to be damaged at the time of loading. There was damage at the bottom portion of the drum. From the discovery of the release to the final cleanup process was approximately 2-3 hours.

item.title: Report I-2023080061
item.description:
Report I-2023080061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: BRADNER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRAZIL TRUCKING INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approximately 8:00 am on August 10, 2023, our driver stated that he noticed a transmission light on his dash, and he felt the trailer dragging. he then heard a loud pup while driving EB on US highway 6, thinking he blew a tire. He did not see any debris as he looked to his rear view mirror, and he stated the traffic was very heavy with no shoulder to safely pull off the road on a 2 lane road. So he proceeded to the nearest safe haven so he could inspect the problem. He approached the Fuel Mart on Hwy 6 and US 23, and pulled off of the road. As he walked to the rear of the trailer to inspect the incident, he found it to be on fire around the back axle and tires. He proceeded to get the fire extinguisher from his truck, but was unable to extinguish the fire. Another bystander had already called 911, so he disconnected his truck from the trailer. To the best of our knowledge, we believe that while he was driving, he either blew a brake chamber, or had an air leak causing the axle to drag. Which subsequently caused the tires to drag, and initiate the transmission light on his dash. Followed by the tire to blow out and getting hot enough to spark a fire burning the tires. By the time the Fire Department arrived the fire was hot enough to burn a hole through the back side wall of the aluminum trailer.

item.title: Report I-2023080049
item.description:
Report I-2023080049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T00:33:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: GREENSBURG
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LPG LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7-25-23: A driver inadvertently loaded Ammonia, Anhydrous (UN1005) into a storage tank designated for Propane (UN 1075). As part of the recovery and remediation, the storage tank offloaded into two tanker trailers (MC331 ). On 7-27-23, the pressure relief valve on one of the recovery tanker trailers released a mixture of Ammonia and Propane in to the atmosphere. The release was caused by an increase in pressure caused by an Exothermic Reaction between the two commodities. The valve reset, but an unknown quantity of product was lost. As a result, representatives from PHMSA, the Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Indiana State Police and independent response personnel developed a new and more timely recovery procedure (Liquid Flare). The remaining products were safely rendered safe and the incident was declared complete. A copy of the report from the recovery/remediation company is attached. Risk Management of East Central Indiana LLC. NOTE: The carrier responsible is LPG Logistics LLC USDOT# 3142354. LPG Logisitics is the Owner/Operator Branch of C Three Logistics LLC USDOT# 2961868. LPG Logistics is the responsible party; however, billing and information is handled by C Three Logistics.

item.title: Report I-2023080031
item.description:
Report I-2023080031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-01T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: BAKER CITY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 12:00PM on Tuesday June 20th 2023 The Savannah transport driver (Larry) noticed a leak near the landing gear from his trailer while stopped at a truck stop in Baker City, OR. He immediately place a plastic 5gl bucket underneath it to contain the drips. ~12: 15pm Savannah contacted Aaron Sanislo at Heritage Env. to notify us of the situation. ~12:30pm Aaron contacted Master Env. in Meridian ID who directed him to Steve Rich Env. in Baker City OR. ~1:OOpm Steve Rich arrived on scene reviewed the situation and decided they were incapable of handling the situation and they departed the scene. ~1 :30pm Aaron contacted Master Env. Again to see if they could respond. They said they needed to check with their team in the field and get back to us. ~2:20 Master Env. informed us the earliest they could respond was Thursday June 22nd. So we widened our search. ~ 2:47pm Mike From Heritage Env. contacted Justin Widmer@ Patriot Env. in Richland WA to see if they could respond. They could. Provided Justin with the Savannah Transport drivers (Larry) cell phone info and a brief detailed description of the situation. Please see detailed timeline report from Patriot Environmental continued on additional sheet.
